isis.stitle: TSI 98-03-04 - Air Suspension Mounting Holes Removed From Frame Rails

subjectgroup.subject: Air Suspension Mounting Holes Removed From Frame Rails

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to 91/92/93/9400 models with International air suspension and 12.5 inch air spring height built December 1, 1998 and later.

Effective December 1, 1998, 91/92/93/94/9900 models built with the International air suspension and 12.5 inch air spring height will require one hole in the frame rail, instead of three holes, to mount the suspension air springs. Only the center hole in the air spring top mounting bracket will be used to mount the air spring to the frame rail.

note.para: The air spring mounting bracket will continue to have the three mounting holes ( Figure 1). Do not drill the frame rail to accommodate the three hole mounting bracket.
